title: Manchester United star Daniel James insists he was not knocked out after blow to head
text:
James hit the turf at force after a blow to the head (Picture: Getty)

Daniel James insists he wasn’t knocked out after suffering a sickening blow to the head during Wales’ draw with Croatia on Sunday.

The Manchester United midfielder was down for several minutes after Croatia defender Domagoj Vida clattered into him from behind.

James was spread eagled on the turf, but remarkably was allowed to continue playing after passing concussion protocols.

Replays appeared to show James had been knocked out cold, but the young forward denied he lost consciousness.

James appeared to be out cold (Picture: Getty)

‘There was a few tackles flying in but you always expect it in these games,’ he said after the 1-1 draw.

‘I’m fine. I think he just caught me in the head, but I didn’t get knocked out fortunately.’

Wales’ medical staff attended to James on the pitch, but concerns were raised about why the winger was allowed to play on.

Responding to that question, Wales boss Ryan Giggs suggested the 21-year-old was merely play acting.

‘Daniel James went down and stayed down with a bit of acting,’ Giggs told Sky Sports.

‘But the medical staff went over, he was compos mentis and we did all the checks at half-time and he was fine.’
